paper_metadata.title: Ser77Tyr transthyretin amyloidosis in Israel: Initial manifestations and diagnostic features
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR Ser77Tyr variant, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

patients.demographics: Mean age 62 ± 5.7 years, range 49–70; 19 patients diagnosed with amyloidosis, 30 amyloid-negative carriers.
patients.phenotype: ATTRS77Y associated with late-onset progressive polyneuropathy, carpal tunnel syndrome, and cardiac disease.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mean age at diagnosis was 62 ± 5.7 years.
One patient (case 2) had no biopsy available and in that case ATTR diagnosis was based on the presence of cardiomyopathy.
One patient who was treated with liver transplantation at age 62 died due to amyloid-related cardiac complications at the age of 70.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms, but positive for amyloid in skin biopsy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In two patients an endocardial biopsy was also obtained and was positive as well.

functional_data.summary: The Ser77Tyr mutation is associated with amyloid deposition and clinical manifestations of amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The Ser77Tyr mutation is inherited in an autosomal dominant manner.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the penetrance of the Ser77Tyr mutation in a specific population.
key_quotes: The probability for disease diagnosis increased from 4.4% at age 49 to 100% at 70.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was clearly presented in the results and tables.
